alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Johnson; Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 06 at 5:37PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Martin, southeastern Johnson, northeastern Floyd and northern Pike Counties through 615 PM EST... At 536 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Dicks Creek, or near Prestonsburg, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... McCombs around 540 PM EST. Moree, Pleasant, Gulnare, Prince, Davella, Preece and Delong around 545 PM EST. Threeforks, Laura, Jarad, Heenan, Varney, Piso, McClure, Coalpoint and Pilgrim around 550 PM EST. Rural, Whitepost, Conder, Hatfield Station, Heisey, Sidney, Canada and Oppy around 555 PM EST. Other locations in the path of this storm include Forest Hills, Turkey Creek, Belfry, Hardy and Huddy. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
